intro: Ptilostemon hispanicus, commonly known as the Spanish ptilostemon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ptilostemon hispanicus is often found in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to Mediterranean climates.
